courses.title: Marine Engineering at the Management Level

topics.title: Definition of Terms
topics.description: Defining the meaning of International System of Units, Force, Pressure, Weight, Density, Relative Density, Work, Energy

topics.title: Thermodynamics
topics.description: A branch of physics which deals with the relationship between heat, energy, and work on a system. There are three principal laws of thermodynamics.

topics.title: Heat
topics.description: An energy that is transferred to a system by way of thermal interaction. Introduces the heat engine, turbine, compressors, thermodynamic cycle, working fluid, temperature-entropy, enthalpy-entropy, pressure-enthalpy, heat transfer, heat conduction

topics.title: Gas Laws
topics.description: Relationship between pressure, volume, and temperature. Introduction of law of heat conduction, Newton's Law of Cooling, Heat Exchangers, Air Conditioning, Boyle's Law, Charles' Law, Ideal Gas Law, Polytrophic Law, Specific Heat Capacity, Psychometric Chart, Mollier Diagram, Marine Applications

topics.title: Steam Plant
topics.description: In relation to water and defining wet steam, saturated steam, super heated steam, enthalpy, entropy, evaporation, condensation, boiler horsepower

topics.title: Mechanics
topics.description: Inertia at the resistance to change of motion, the method of balancing a disc, the normal tolerance of out-of-balance forces, the static balancing of propeller, the dynamic balancing of rotating elements (impellers, bowl assembly of purifiers, crankshaft).

topics.title: Hydraulics and Pneumatics
topics.description: Fundamental concepts, component symbols, construction, functions and application to Hydraulics and Pneumatics, circuit diagrams, and troubleshooting of fluid power systems, shipboard applications

chapters.title: Operating Principles of Ship Power Installations and Refrigeration

topics.title: Analyse the Diesel Engine Shop Trial and Sea Trial Data
subtopics: Brake power, Indicated power of diesel engines, indicated power of turbines, break mean, effective pressure, engine efficiencies.
Graph of energy  distribution at varying loads

Work out preventive measures taken to ensure deviations from trial data are kept to minimum
Calculate the specific fuel and cylinder oil consumption

topics.title: Explains the fundamentals of Refrigeration and the vapour compression system
subtopics: Pressure is directly proportional to saturation in temperature
Use of tools and test equipment for servicing and repair

Naval Architecture and Ship Construction, including damage control
